intro: Sonchus stenophyllus, commonly known as narrow-leaf sowthistle, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster, producing small achenes as seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
